title: 'I'm sick of my friends judging what I eat. What should I say?'
text:
Dear A&E

I’m sick of my friends commenting on what I eat. When I used to order pudding after every meal and guzzle vats of wine over dinner, they said nothing. But now I’m trying to eat cleaner (no sugar, less booze), they have an opinion on everything that passes my lips – which all came to a head at a birthday party. I asked them to stop commenting, but they carried on. One emailed to say she was worried about my ‘crash diet’ after I ordered sashimi and edamame beans. It’s infuriating. What do I do?

Dear Furious
